qas.question: Some observers thought that the Persian Gulf War would have tank battles similar to what war?

answers.text: North Africa during World War II

qas.question: What conflict was supposed to have provided Iraqi forces with battle experience?
What equipment did the Iraqi army possess?

answers.text: late model Soviet tanks and jet fighters

qas.question: Prior to the Persian Gulf War, where and when was the last major American military conflict?
What problem did the Iraqi forces have?

plausible_answers.text: North Africa during World War II

qas.question: ome observers thought that the Chinese Gulf War would have tank battles similar to what war?
What conflict was supposed to have provided Iranian forces with battle experience?

plausible_answers.text: late model Soviet tanks and jet fighters

qas.question: What equipment did the Iranian army possess?
Prior to the Persian Gulf War, where and when was the last major African military conflict?
What problem did the Iranian forces have?

context: Before the war, many observers believed the US and its allies could win but might suffer substantial casualties (certainly more than any conflict since Vietnam), and that the tank battles across the harsh desert might rival those of <a0_0><b5_0>North Africa during World War II<b5_0/><a0_0/>. After nearly 50 years of proxy wars, and constant fears of another war in Europe between NATO and the Warsaw Pact, some thought the Persian Gulf War might finally answer the question of which military philosophy would have reigned supreme. Iraqi forces were battle-hardened after <a1_0><b6_0>8 years of war with Iran<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and they were well equipped with <a2_0><b7_0>late model Soviet tanks and jet fighters<b7_0/><a2_0/>, but <a4_0>the <b9_0>antiaircraft weapons were crippled<b9_0/><a4_0/>; in comparison, the US had no large-scale combat experience since its withdrawal from <a3_0><b8_0>Vietnam nearly 20 years earlier<b8_0/><a3_0/>, and major changes in US doctrine, equipment and technology since then had never been tested under fire.
